qas.question: WHo was first invloved in the polonization?

answers.text: the highest members of the nobility

qas.question: Who imposed various sanction on the people?
What was an example of imposing sanctions on lithuanians?

answers.text: removing Lithuania from the names of the Gubernyas

qas.question: What did the russian officials announce as a sanction?

answers.text: "Lithuanians are Russians seduced by Poles and Catholicism"

qas.question: What language was banned from printing on books?

context: The process of polonization took place over a lengthy period of time. At first only <a0_0>the highest members of the nobility<a0_0/> were involved, although gradually a wider group of the population was affected. The major effects on the lesser Lithuanian nobility took place after various sanctions were imposed by the <a1_0>Russian Empire<a1_0/> such as <a2_0>removing Lithuania from the names of the Gubernyas<a2_0/> few years after the November Uprising. After the January Uprising the sanctions went further, and Russian officials announced that <a3_0>"Lithuanians are Russians seduced by Poles and Catholicism"<a3_0/> and began to intensify russification, and to ban the printing of books in the <a4_0>Lithuanian language.
